intro: Talauma soembensis, commonly known as the Sumba talauma, is a flowering plant native to the island of Sumba in Indonesia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are elliptical and have a glossy surface, often with a reddish hue when young. Talauma soembensis is typically found in humid, forested areas at moderate elevations.
